skill.summary: Run PostgreSQL queries and meta-commands via CLI
skill.author: Bind

security_audit.summary: Legitimate PostgreSQL query tool. Executes external psql commands and reads standard database credentials via environment variables. All 62 static findings are false positives stemming from pattern-matching without context. The scanner misidentified markdown code formatting as shell execution, PostgreSQL environment variables as sensitive data access, and documentation links as network indicators.

content.user_title: Run PostgreSQL queries via command line
content.value_statement: Database queries require switching between code editors and terminal windows. This skill lets you execute SQL queries and psql meta-commands directly from your AI assistant without leaving your workflow.
actual_capabilities: Execute SQL queries against PostgreSQL databases
Execute SQL files for migrations and seed data
Output results in tuples-only, JSON, or formatted modes
Set query timeouts for long-running operations
limitations: Requires psql CLI client installed separately
Requires bun runtime to execute queries
No persistent database connection between queries

use_cases.title: Database schema exploration
use_cases.description: List tables, describe table structures, and view indexes using meta-commands without switching to terminal.

use_cases.title: Run analytical queries
use_cases.description: Execute aggregation queries, COUNT operations, and GROUP BY statements to analyze database contents.

use_cases.title: Database administration tasks
use_cases.description: Check connection counts, table sizes, and run migration files to manage database operations.

best_practices: Store database credentials securely in environment variables or .env files
Use --timeout flag for long-running analytical queries to prevent hanging
Use --tuples output mode when piping results to other scripts or tools
anti_patterns: Do not use this skill to query production databases without explicit authorization
Avoid executing untrusted SQL files without reviewing their contents first
Do not expose PG* environment variables in logs or error messages

faq.question: Which PostgreSQL versions are supported?
faq.answer: Any PostgreSQL version that works with the standard psql CLI client. The skill uses standard psql commands.

faq.question: What is the default query timeout?
faq.answer: The default timeout is 30 seconds. Use the --timeout option to increase this for long-running queries.

faq.question: Can I use this with cloud databases?
faq.answer: Yes. Set PGHOST, PGPORT, PGUSER, and PGPASSWORD to your cloud database endpoint credentials.

faq.question: Are my database credentials stored safely?
faq.answer: Credentials are read from environment variables only during query execution. Never hardcode passwords in queries.

faq.question: Why is my query timing out?
faq.answer: Complex queries or large datasets may exceed the 30-second default. Use --timeout 60000 for 60 seconds.

faq.question: How is this different from other database skills?
faq.answer: This skill uses the official psql CLI directly, supporting all PostgreSQL features and meta-commands without abstraction layers.
